questions.question: A train running at the speed of 60 km/hr crosses a pole in 9 seconds. What is the length of the train?
questions.explanation: Speed = 60 km/hr = 60 × (5/18) = 50/3 m/s. Distance = Speed × Time = (50/3) × 9 = 150 m.

questions.question: A train 125 m long passes a man, running at 5 km/hr in the same direction in which the train is going, in 10 seconds. The speed of the train is:
questions.explanation: Relative speed = Distance / Time = 125 / 10 = 12.5 m/s = 45 km/hr. If man runs at 5 km/hr, train speed = 45 + 5 = 50 km/hr.

questions.question: The length of the bridge, which a train 130 metres long and travelling at 45 km/hr can cross in 30 seconds, is:
questions.explanation: Speed = 45 km/hr = 45 × (5/18) = 12.5 m/s. Distance covered in 30 sec = 12.5 × 30 = 375 m. Bridge length = 375 − 130 = 245 m.

questions.question: Two trains running in opposite directions cross a man standing on the platform in 27 seconds and 17 seconds respectively and they cross each other in 23 seconds. The ratio of their speeds is:
questions.explanation: Let speeds be a and b. Train lengths are proportional to times taken to cross the man: L1∝27, L2∝17. When crossing each other: (L1+L2)/(a+b)=23. Solving gives a:b = 3:2.

questions.question: A train passes a station platform in 36 seconds and a man standing on the platform in 20 seconds. If the speed of the train is 54 km/hr, what is the length of the platform?
questions.explanation: Speed = 54 km/hr = 15 m/s. Train length = 15 × 20 = 300 m. Train + platform length = 15 × 36 = 540 m. Platform length = 540 − 300 = 240 m.

questions.question: A sum of Rs. 12,000 is lent at 8% per annum simple interest. What is the interest earned in 2.5 years?
A and B can do a piece of work in 12 and 18 days respectively. They work together for 3 days and then A leaves. How many more days will B alone take to finish the remaining work?
questions.explanation: A's rate = 1/12, B's = 1/18, together = 5/36 per day. Work done in 3 days = 3 × 5/36 = 5/12. Remaining = 1 − 5/12 = 7/12. B alone takes (7/12) ÷ (1/18) = (7/12)×18 = 10.5 days.

questions.question: Two cards are drawn at random from a well-shuffled deck of 52 cards. What is the probability that both cards drawn are kings (without replacement)?
questions.explanation: Number of ways to choose 2 kings = C(4,2) = 6. Total ways = C(52,2) = 1326. Probability = 6/1326 = 1/221.

questions.question: A pipe A can fill a tank in 15 hours, pipe B in 20 hours, and a waste pipe C can empty it in 60 hours. If all three are opened together, how long will it take to fill the tank?
In how many distinct ways can the letters of the word 'LEVEL' be arranged?
questions.explanation: Letters: L,L,E,E,V (5 letters with L repeated twice and E twice). Number of arrangements = 5!/(2!×2!) = 120/4 = 30.
